title: Six killed , 100 wounded in Ukrainian drone and missile attacks , Russian authorities say - 24 - Jun - 2024
message:
Russian authorities say six people have been killed and over 100 wounded in Ukrainian drone and missile attacks on Sunday.
In Ukraine, the second day of Russia's aerial bombing of Kharkiv in the north-east killed at least one person.
Russia's Defence Ministry said both Ukraine and the US bore "responsibility for a deliberate missile strike on civilians".
One killed, 11 wounded by Russian strikes on Kharkiv, official saysA fresh attack on Kharkiv killed at least one person and wounded 11 on Sunday, according to local officials.
Sunday's attacks came after Russia struck Kharkiv on Saturday afternoon with four aerial bombs, hitting a five-story residential building and killing three people.
event_breakdown:
* Russian authorities say six people have been killed and over 100 wounded in Ukrainian drone and missile attacks on Sunday.
* In Ukraine, the second day of Russia's aerial bombing of Kharkiv in the north-east killed at least one person.

title: Russia points finger at US for deadly Ukrainian attack on Crimea
message:
Russian authorities say the U.S. is responsible for a deadly Ukrainian attack on the Crimean Peninsula on Sunday.
The Russian Defense Ministry said four Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) missiles, which the U.S. supplied to Ukraine, were equipped with cluster warheads.
The missiles were shot down by air defense systems, the ministry said, while a fifth missile was detonated midair.
RUSSIA ‘OPEN TO DIALOGUE’ WITH US: KREMLINMikhail Razvozhayev, the Moscow-installed governor of the city of Sevastopol, said 151 people were wounded in the incident.
Earlier this year, the U.S. started supplying Ukraine with ATACMS missiles, giving the country the ability to strike targets within a 186-mile range.
event_breakdown: Four Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) missiles were fired at the Crimean peninsula by the US-backed Ukrainian forces on Sunday. Ukraine says the missiles were aimed at military targets, but Russia said the missiles were equipped with cluster warheads. Two of the missiles were shot down by Russian air defense systems and a third was detonated midair, but a fifth missile, which was the one that was shot down, landed in an area to the west of the Black Sea resort of Sochi. The Russian Ministry of Defense said 151 people were injured in the attack, which it says proves that the U.S. is supplying Ukraine with weapons.

title: Russia says US is responsible for deadly Ukrainian attack on Crimea
message:
Russia said on Sunday that the United States was responsible for a Ukrainian attack on the Russian-annexed Crimean Peninsula with five U.S.-supplied missiles that killed four people, including two children, and injured 151 more.
Footage on Russian state television showed people running from a beach and some people being carried off on sun loungers.
The Defense Ministry said U.S. specialists had set the missiles' flight coordinates on the basis of information from U.S. spy satellites, meaning Washington was directly responsible.
The United States began supplying Ukraine with longer range ATACMS missiles, which have a 300-kilometer (186-mile) range, earlier this year.
Russia will respond to Sunday's attack, the Defense Ministry said, without elaborating.

title: At least five dead and over 100 injured in Ukrainian strike in Russian occupied Crimea
message:
CNN —At least five people were killed and over 100 injured when missile fragments scattered over beachgoers during a Ukrainian strike on the city of Sevastopol in Russia-occupied Crimea, authorities say.
“Unfortunately, we currently have 124 victims, of which three [are] dead children and two [are] dead adults,” Sevastopol Governor Mikhail Razvozhayev said on Telegram.
One of victims killed in the Ukrainian strike was the daughter of Oleg Averyanov, Deputy Mayor of Magadan.
Since the outbreak of the war in Ukraine, it has come under sporadic attack from Ukrainian forces.
Before Russia’s 2022 invasion of Ukraine, Sevastopol – the largest city in Crimea – was a popular tourist destination for Russians.
event_breakdown: Five people were killed and over 100 were injured after missile fragments scattered over beachgoers during a Ukrainian strike on the city of Sevastopol in Russia-occupied Crimea.

title: Peace - Loving Hezbollah Storing Huge Cache of Iranian Weapons at Largest Civilian Airport in Lebanon
message:
Hezbollah is storing huge quantities of Iranian weapons, missiles, and explosives in Beirut’s main civilian airport, according to airport whistleblowers.
The cache allegedly includes Iranian-made Falaq unguided artillery rockets, Fateh-110 short-range missiles, road-mobile ballistic missiles and M-600 missiles with ranges of over 150 to 200 miles.
AdvertisementAlso at the airport is the AT-14 Kornet, laser-guided anti-tank guided missiles (ATGM), huge quantities of Burkan short-range ballistic missile and explosive RDX, a toxic white powder also known as cyclonite or hexagon.
The disclosures will raise fears that the Rafic Hariri airport, just four miles from the city centre, could become a major military target.
event_breakdown: Hezbollah Storing Iranian Weapons at Beirut Airport

title: Members of rapid - response squad injured from anti - tank missile while driving ATV in Metula
message:
Two members of a rapid-response squad were injured on Sunday evening by an anti-tank missile that hit the city of Metula in northern Israel.
The incident occurred when the members of the squad were accompanying a family from Metula who came to see their home, which had been hit by Hezbollah missiles.
The two were evacuated for medical treatment at Rambam Hospital in Haifa.
The IDF Spokesperson’s Unit confirmed that two launches were detected that crossed from Lebanese territory towards the Metula area, and that damage was caused in the area.
The Rambam Hospital updated on Monday morning that one of the victims, in his 40s, underwent an operation overnight and was admitted to general intensive care unit.
location: Metula, a city in northern Israel

title: Lebanon denies weapons are stored at Beirut airport : Deceptions and lies
message:
The Lebanese air transport association on Sunday denied claims that Hezbollah has been storing at Beirut’s main airport.
The organization that runs day-to-day operations at the airport dismissed claims that Iranian weapons were being flown in and stored at the transport hub.
The Lebanese air transport association said in response that the claims were “deceptions and lies aimed at exposing Beirut airport and its workers”, and announced a press tour of the airport on Monday.
Hezbollah has previously been accused of using the civilian airport for weapons storage, but the whistleblowers claimed it has escalated since the conflict between Hezbollah and Israel intensified in October.
Staff at the airport and intelligence sources claimed in interviews with The Telegraph that weapons were travelling through the airport and being stored on site.

title: Netanyahu Says Major Operations in Gaza Will End  Very Soon
message:
(Bloomberg) -- Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel will soon end the intense stage of fighting in Gaza and will focus on targeted operations against Hamas.
“It will be very soon,” Netanyahu said when asked in a TV interview whether fighting in the southern city of Rafah will end in a month’s time.
It was his first interview with an Israeli media outlet since the Oct. 7 attacks, in which Hamas militants invaded southern Israel from Gaza, killing 1,200 people and kidnapping another 250.
“If we can, we’ll do this by diplomatic means, if not it’ll be achieved in another way,” Netanyahu said.
“Netanyahu has made clear we will not leave Gaza until we return all hostages, living and deceased.”©2024 Bloomberg L.P.

title: Thousands of Iran - backed fighters offer to join Hezbollah in its fight against Israel
message:
BEIRUT — Thousands of fighters from Iran-backed groups in the Middle East are ready to come to Lebanon to join with the militant group Hezbollah in its battle with Israel if the simmering conflict escalates into a full-blown war, officials with Iran-backed factions and analysts say.
Almost daily exchanges of fire have occurred along Lebanon’s frontier with northern Israel since fighters from the Hamas-controlled Gaza Strip staged a bloody assault on southern Israel in early October that set off a war in Gaza.
The situation to the north worsened this month after an Israeli airstrike killed a senior Hezbollah military commander in southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah retaliated by firing hundreds of rockets and explosive drones into northern Israel.
Israeli officials have threatened a military offensive in Lebanon if there is no negotiated deal to push Hezbollah away from the border.

title: Gunmen kill six police officers as church and synagogue attacked in Russia Dagestan
message:
Gunmen opened fire at a synagogue, an Orthodox church and a police post in Russia’s North Caucasus region of Dagestan on Sunday, killing six policemen and injuring 12, the interior ministry said.
A local religious organisation in the mainly Muslim region put the death toll at nine, including seven police officers.
The interior ministry, quoted by Russian news agencies, said four gunmen had been shot dead as the incidents unfolded.
A local official said another had been killed during a shootout at a church in Makhachkala, the region’s main administrative centre.
Restive Dagestan was hit by an Islamist insurgency in the 2000s, spilling over from neighbouring Chechnya, with Russian security forces moving aggressively to combat extremists in the region.

title: Gaza Conflict , Israeli Instability , and US Relations : three knots
message:
These days our general situation seems to be immersed in at least three interwoven Gordian knots.
One concerns the lingering fighting in the Gaza Strip and the prospect of the current border confrontation between Israel and Hezbollah turning into a full-scale war.
The same applies to his statement, on the same occasion, that if an alternative will not be found to Hamas in the Gaza Strip, the latter will remain in power there.
The position of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu appears to be the exact opposite on all these issues.

title: Suspected Houthi attack targets vessel in waters further away than all previous assaults

In the Yaeyama islands, where the U.S. troops did not land, many people were killed by bombardment and malaria, according to Yaeyama Peace Memorial Museum’s website.
Of the evacuees, 1,587 contracted malaria and 477 died of the disease, according to a Yaeyama Peace Memorial Museum spokeswoman.
Nearly 200 names were added this year to the Cornerstone of Peace at Okinawa Peace Memorial Park in Itoman, Okinawa, Japan, on June 19, 2024.

title: CRPF Jawan From Kerala Among 2 Killed In Naxal Attack In Chhattisgarh
message:
(MENAFN- AsiaNet News) Two Central Reserve Force (CRPF) personnel, one of whom was a Malayali, were killed on Sunday in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district when Naxalites detonated a truck using an improvised explosive device (IED).
The deceased Keralite, Vishnu R, 35, hailed from Palode in Thiruvananthapuram.
The security personnel were traveling in a truck and on motorcycles.
Naxalites triggered an IED blast targeting the truck, which resulted in the deaths of constable Shailendra (29) and the driver, Vishnu R (35).
The late Vishnu was the son of Raghuvar and Ajitha, residing at Anizham House, Palode Farm Junction.

title: Orthodox priest , multiple police killed in gunmen attack in Russia North Caucasus , officials say
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelGunmen opened fire at a synagogue, an Orthodox church and a police post in attacks across two cities in Russia's North Caucasus region of Dagestan on Sunday, killing an Orthodox priest and multiple police officers, the region's head said.The death toll from Sunday's attacks in the southern Russian region of Dagestan has risen to 19 people, Russia's investigative committee said on Monday.
"This is a day of tragedy for Dagestan and the whole country," Sergei Melikov, governor of the Dagestan region , said in a video published early on Monday on the Telegram messaging app.Melikov said that more than 19 police officers "fell victim" to what he said was a " terrorist attack "," but he did not specify how many of the police were killed and how many were injured.
Russia's Interfax agency reported that at least 19 police officers were killed.The simultaneous attacks across the cities of Makhachkala and Derbent came three months after 145 people were killed in an attack claimed by the Islamic State on a concert hall near Moscow, Russia's worst terrorist attack in years.There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the attacks in the volatile North Caucasus region.
A spokesman for the Russian Orthodox Church said on Telegram that the priest, Nikolai Kotelnikov, was "brutally murdered".Six of the gunmen were shot and killed as the incidents unfolded, Melikov said.
Authorities were quoted as saying that both the synagogue and church were ablaze, and that two attackers had been killed.Russian media cited the head of the country's federation of Jewish communities as calling for people to avoid reacting to "provocations".In Israel, the Foreign Ministry said the synagogue in Derbent had been burned to the ground and shots had been fired at a second synagogue in Makhachkala.

title: Thousands of Iran - Backed Fighters Ready to Join Hezbollah in War Against Israel
message:
Thousands of Iran-backed foreign fighters are reportedly poised to join forces with Hezbollah if its ongoing conflict with Israel along the Lebanese border escalates into all-out war.
Some of the groups have already launched attacks against Israel and its allies since the war between Israel and Hamas erupted on Oct. 7, AP said.
Qassim Qassir, an expert on Hezbollah, told AP that the combat being waged now primarily involved firing missiles and didn't require an influx of militants.
The vast majority of the Lebanese casualties were Hezbollah fighters but 70 casualties involved civilians and noncombatants, AP said.
Israel and Hezbollah last engaged in large-scale combat in summer of 2006, when they fought a 34-day war that killed about 1,200 people in Lebanon and 140 in Israel.

message:

Footage on Russian state television showed people running from a beach and some people being carried off on sun loungers.
The United States began supplying Ukraine with longer range ATACMS missiles, which have a 300-kilometre (186-mile) range, earlier this year.

Russia is likely placing military facilities near civilians to deter Ukrainian strikes, experts say.
Russia is likely placing military facilities near civilian areas in Crimea to try to deter further Ukrainian strikes, military analysts said.
Placing potential military targets near civilian infrastructure is a strategy Russia has leveraged in the past, with the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant and schools in occupied Ukraine used to shield Russian military equipment, the ISW reported.
However, in doing so, Russia is likely breaking its own International Humanitarian Law, which says that military command must refrain from placing military targets close to or in highly populated areas.

title: South Korea completes deployment of KUH - 1 Surion to army
message:
South Korea has completed the deployment of the Korea Aerospace Industries (KAI) KUH-1 Surion utility helicopter to the country’s army.
The programme involved four production contracts that saw “about 200” examples produced for the army, according to the Defense Acquisition Program Administration (DAPA).
Following the type’s development from 2006, the army received its first Surion in 2012, with deliveries completed this month.
In army service the type performs a range of missions, including assault, cargo airlift, and command and control.
Cirium fleets data indicates that in addition to the army, variants are in service with the marines, coastguard, the South Korean police, and other agencies.

title: Lebanon denies weapons are stored at Beirut airport : Deceptions and lies
message:
The Lebanese air transport association on Sunday denied claims that Hezbollah has been storing at Beirut’s main airport.
The organization that runs day-to-day operations at the airport dismissed claims that Iranian weapons were being flown in and stored at the transport hub.
The Lebanese air transport association said in response that the claims were “deceptions and lies aimed at exposing Beirut airport and its workers”, and announced a press tour of the airport on Monday.
Hezbollah has previously been accused of using the civilian airport for weapons storage, but the whistleblowers claimed it has escalated since the conflict between Hezbollah and Israel intensified in October.
Staff at the airport and intelligence sources claimed in interviews with The Telegraph that weapons were travelling through the airport and being stored on site.

message:
Israeli officials have threatened a military offensive in Lebanon if there is no negotiated end to push Hezbollah away from the border.
U.S. President Joe Biden’s senior adviser, Amos Hochstein, met with officials in Lebanon and Israel last week in an effort to deescalate tensions.
It is harder to fend off the shorter-range rockets that Hezbollah fires routinely across the border into Israel, he said.
The situation escalated this month after an Israeli airstrike killed a senior Hezbollah military commander in southern Lebanon.
Hezbollah retaliated by firing hundreds of rockets and explosive drones into northern Israel and Israel responded with a heavy assault on the militant group.

title: The IDF on track to dismantle Hamas last brigade in Rafah
message:
The Israel Defence Forces is pursuing a phased approach in its ongoing offensive against Hamas’s last stronghold in Rafah, Gaza.
According to Israeli military assessments, Hamas’s final functioning brigade will be dismantled in Rafah within weeks.
According to an IDF source, of Hamas’s four Rafah battalions, only two are currently functional.
On June 20, the IDF reported that the Nahal infantry brigade, operating under the 162nd Division, had discovered large quantities of hidden weapons and tunnel shafts within and under civilian residences in Rafah.
On June 22, the Israeli Air Force attempted to eliminate Hamas’s head of operations, Raed Sa’ad, in a strike in Gaza City.

* The Israel Defence Forces pursuing a phased approach in its ongoing offensive against Hamas’s last stronghold in Rafah, Gaza.

title: Trash war : What inside the balloons that North Korea is sending across the border ?
message:
The matter has escalated after North Korea has been sending trash-laden balloons towards its neighbour.
“North Korea is again floating (suspected) balloons carrying trash towards the South,” reported news agency AFP quoting the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
Why is North Korea sending trash balloons across the border?
Experts say there are now no legal grounds for the government to stop activists from sending balloons into North Korea.
In response to North Korea’s trash balloons, South Korea completely suspended a 2018 military deal with the North, which was meant to reduce tensions between the neighbours.

message:

Controlled by the Soviet Union, East Germany became a socialist state.
The fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989 paved the way for German reunification, and by 1990, East Germany ceased to exist​.

title: Netanyahu announces winding down of operations in Gaza , transfer of Israel troops to Lebanon border
message:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday that the current phase of fighting against Hamas in Gaza is winding down, setting the stage for Israel to send more troops to its northern border to confront the Lebanese Hezbollah group, reports AP.
But he said fewer troops would be needed in Gaza, freeing up forces to battle Hezbollah.
“First and foremost, for defense,” he added, but also to allow tens of thousands of displaced Israelis to return home.
Netanyahu said he hoped a diplomatic solution to the crisis could be found, but vowed to solve the problem “in a different way” if needed.
In the interview, Netanyahu said that Israel’s offensive in Gaza is winding down, but added that Israel would have to continue “mowing” operations—targeted strikes aimed at preventing Hamas from regrouping.
event_breakdown:
1- Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that the current phase of fighting against Hamas in Gaza is winding down.
2- Netanyahu said that the Israeli military will focus on confronting the Lebanese Hezbollah group next.

title: Fact Check : This Civil War Veteran Allegedly Survived Decades After Being Shot in the Forehead . We Checked the Records
message:
Claim:Civil War veteran Jacob Miller lived more than 50 years after surviving a musket ball shot to the forehead.
Rating:Rating: TrueThe story of Civil War soldier Jacob Miller (spelled "Millar" in some instances), is seemingly miraculous, if nothing else.
According to NPS records, Miller served as a private with the 6th Regiment of the Indiana Infantry in the Union Army.
Snopes contacted the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) in Washington, D.C., for access to Miller's records.
Snopes has examined other claims involving the Civil War, which can be viewed in our archive.
event_breakdown: Civil War veteran Jacob Miller survived a musket ball shot to the forehead and lived more than 50 years.

title: EU adopts 14th package of sanctions against Russia
message:
The EU adopted a 14th package of sanctions against Russia.
The package contains important new energy-related measures targeting liquified natural gas (LNG), and measures targeting vessels which support Russia’s war.
As regards LNG, the package prohibits all future investments in, and exports to, LNG projects under construction in Russia.
Moreover, the package prohibits the import of Russian LNG into specific terminals which are not connected to the EU gas pipeline network.
The package also finetunes the import ban on Russian diamonds already agreed in the 12th sanctions package.
event_breakdown: 14th package of sanctions against Russia - targets liquified natural gas (LNG)

title: Third Estonian volunteer killed in action in Ukraine
message:
Martin Jaager, an Estonian citizen who served in Ukraine's defense forces, was killed in combat in the Luhansk region, Estonian news outlet Postimees reported on June 23.
Jaager was killed on June 22 near the village of Raigorodka, close to the border of the Kharkiv and Luhansk Oblasts.
He was the third Estonian to die defending Ukraine, and was a member of the Third Assault Division.
He joined the defense forces in Ukraine over a year ago, and had served in various units before joining the Third Assault Division a month prior to his death.
In March 2023, Ivo Juurak was the first Estonian volunteer who was killed in action in Ukraine, followed by Tanel Kriggul in September.
event_breakdown: Martin Jaager, an Estonian citizen, was killed in combat in the Luhansk region of Ukraine on June 22nd. Jaager was previously reported to have been killed in Ukraine on June 22nd.

title: Catholic prelate in Japan calls for reevaluation of defense policies
message:
Catholic prelate in Japan calls for reevaluation of defense policiesThe bishop of the Diocese of Naha in southern Japan challenged the prevailing notions of peace and defense, criticizing policies that prioritize national security over genuine human safety and coexistence.
In his message for the Okinawa Memorial Day on June 23, Bishop Wayne Francis Berndt warned that such policies could escalate into conflicts akin to genocide.
Bishop Berndt criticized the use of the term “defense,” which often justifies aggressive actions causing significant human suffering.
Okinawa Memorial Day, observed annually on June 23 in Japan’s Okinawa Prefecture, commemorates those lost in the Battle of Okinawa.
Initially established in 1961 by the Government of the Ryukyu Islands during the occupation of Japan, Okinawa Memorial Day was intended to honor and pray for the relatives killed in the battle.
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Catholic prelate in Japan calls for reevaluation of defense policies.
Event 2: Bishop Wayne Francis Berndt warned against policies that prioritize national security over genuine human safety and coexistence.
Event 3: Okinawa Memorial Day is observed annually on June 23 in Japan’s Okinawa Prefecture.

title: Eisenhower Aircraft Carrier Group Heads Home After Months Battling Houthis in Red Sea
message:
The Houthis, designated a terrorist organization by the United States, have harassed the Red Sea shipping lane for months with missiles and explosive-laden drones.
The Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group and its sailors have, in turn, intercepted dozens of Houthi missiles and drones, shielding numerous commercial ships in their journeys through the Red Sea.
The strike group saw its Red Sea deployment extended twice as the Houthis continued their attacks.
CENTCOM reported that the Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group logged more than 30,000 flight hours and sailed more than 55,000 miles as part of its deployment.
Nevertheless, the Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group’s Red Sea mission had been one of the most intense periods of sea combat for the U.S. Navy since World War II.
location: The Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group's Red Sea mission
event_breakdown:
![The Eisenhower Carrier Strike Group in the Red Sea](https://i.imgur.com/RqQtjXS.jpg)

title: Russia says US - made missiles used in deadly Crimea attack
message:
The Russian Foreign Ministry on Monday claimed U.S.-made missiles were used in a deadly weekend attack on Russia-annexed Crimea.
It added U.S.-supplied ATACMS missiles were used in the attack, which reportedly killed four people and injured more than 150 others.
Western-supplied weaponry has been used by Ukrainian forces throughout Kyiv’s war with Russia, which began more than three years ago.
Western allies have previously declared Crimea, which Russia annexed from Ukraine in 2014, is a fair target for Ukraine, the AP noted.
Those killed in Sunday’s attack included two children who were hit by falling debris from Ukrainian missiles shot down near Sevastopol, a port city in Crimea, the AP reported, citing Russian officials.
event_breakdown: Russian Foreign Ministry claims U.S.-made missiles were used in a deadly weekend attack on Russia-annexed Crimea. Russian authorities say four people were killed in the attack and more than 150 were injured.

title: With another setback for cease - fire talks , worries of full - scale war for Israel and Lebanon escalate
message:
Israel and Hezbollah each have lessons from their last war, in 2006, a monthlong conflict that ended in a draw.
A United Nations resolution ending the war called for withdrawal of Israeli forces from Lebanon and a demilitarized zone on Lebanon’s side of the border.
Iran-backed Hezbollah initially seemed caught off-guard by Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack on Israel, a regional ally, but began firing rockets into northern Israel the following day.
In a war with Hezbollah, there would be no point in additional evacuations since the militia’s rockets and missiles can reach all of Israel.
A full-scale war would likely spread to multiple fronts, escalating the involvement of Iranian proxies in Syria, Iraq and Yemen — and perhaps draw in Iran itself.
event_breakdown: Israel and Hezbollah strike each other in Syria, with Hezbollah firing anti-tank missiles at Israeli military vehicles, killing two Israeli soldiers. Hezbollah is blamed, and Israel strikes targets in Lebanon.

title: With another setback for cease - fire talks , worries of full - scale war for Israel and Lebanon escalate
message:
Recommended VideosIsrael and Hezbollah each have lessons from their last war, in 2006, a monthlong conflict that ended in a draw.
The 2006 war, six years after Israeli forces that had occupied southern Lebanon withdrew, erupted after Hezbollah captured two Israeli soldiers and killed several others in a cross-border raid.
A United Nations resolution ending the war called for withdrawal of Israeli forces from Lebanon and a demilitarized zone on Lebanon’s side of the border.
In a war with Hezbollah, there would be no point in additional evacuations since the militia’s rockets and missiles can reach all of Israel.
Lebanon has no such network, and shelters would be of little use against massive “bunker buster” bombs Israel has dropped in some parts of Gaza.
event_breakdown:
Israel and Hezbollah have reinforced their militaries since the group waged a monthlong conflict with Israel in 2006.

On Friday, Hezbollah leader Nasrallah said his group would strike Israel with missile barrages if it was attacked. Israel has accused the group of firing missiles from Syria at Israeli soldiers.

Lebanon’s President Michel Aoun has said Israel’s threats against Hezbollah were “part of its ongoing psychological campaign”.

Late last month, a senior Israeli defence official said new intelligence showed that Hezbollah has taken “on-the-ground measures” in recent weeks to beef up its forces and openly display its arsenal in Syria.

Hezbollah-affiliated Al-Manar TV said the group last week said it held three days of military manoeuvres where its units fired multiple rocket launchers.

On Thursday evening, Hezbollah placed a mock-up of an Israeli Merkava tank on a Beirut roundabout that had been renamed in its leader’s honour.

Israel-based analyst Amir Rapaport said Hezbollah has gained “significant experience and knowledge” since 2006, thanks to fighting in Syria and having an “ample” weapons supply.
Locations: Lebanon, Israel
Current event: Nasrallah says Hezbollah will strike Israel with missiles

title: Aerial drone launched by Yemen Houthi rebels hits ship in the Red Sea , causing damage and injuries
message:
DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — An aerial drone launched by Yemen’s Houthi rebels struck and damaged a vessel in the Red Sea on Sunday, officials said, the latest attack by the group targeting shipping in the vital maritime corridor.
The drone attack happened around dawn off the coast of the rebel-held port city of Hodeida, the British military’s United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center said.
Hours after the attack, Houthi military spokesman Brig.
Gen. Yahya Saree claimed the attack, saying the rebels targeted the Transworld Navigator.
Saree claimed without offering evidence the rebels instead used a drone boat in the attack, something contradicted by every other report on the assault.

title: Russia blames US for deadly missile attack on Crimea
message:
Russia on Sunday said the United States had responsibility for a Ukrainian missile attack on Russian-annexed Crimea, which it said killed four people, including two children, and wounded over 100.
A missile exploded above a beach area of the city of Sevastopol, firing shrapnel at people relaxing there, Russian-appointed officials said.
Sevastopol governor Mikhail Razvozhayev initially said in a Telegram video the attack had killed three children and two adults, and wounded nearly 120 people.
Sevastopol regularly comes under fire from Ukraine but Sunday's attack was unusually deadly.
Razvozhayev said the attack hit Uchkuyevka, an area with sandy beaches and hotels.

title: NYC triple stabbing in East Village leaves 1 dead ; man in custody
message:
A NYC triple stabbing left one person dead, as well as two others injured, in the East Village, the NYPD said.
The stabbing happened on Sunday around 5:45 p.m. near Avenue A and East 14th Street.
All three were taken to NYC Health+Hospitals/Bellevue, where the 38-year-old man was pronounced dead, police said.
The 51-year-old is listed in critical condition, while the 32-year-old is listed in stable condition.
A 30-year-old man was taken into custody at the scene, police said.

message:
Ukraine makes its own targeting decisions, Pentagon says2 minutesWASHINGTON (Reuters) – The Pentagon said on Monday that Ukraine makes its own targeting decisions after the Kremlin directly blamed the United States for an attack on Crimea that it said was carried out with U.S.-supplied ATACMS missiles and that killed at least four people and injured 151.
“Ukraine makes its own targeting decisions and conducts its own military operations,” Major Charlie Dietz, a Pentagon spokesperson, said.
“That certainly includes the thousands of innocent Ukrainians who have been killed by Russian forces since this Russian war of aggression began,” the spokesperson said.
Russia said the United States had supplied the weapons, while U.S. military specialists had aimed the weapons and provided data for them.

title: Tampa police arrest man on murder charge in Seminole Heights stabbing
message:
Tampa police have arrested a man in connection to a fatal stabbing behind a shuttered Wendy’s restaurant in Seminole Heights this month.
Police on Saturday arrested Eddy Caron, 57, of Tampa on a first-degree murder charge in the June 12 stabbing of David A. Malzone, 52, records show.
According to Caron’s arrest affidavit, police were called to 1501 E. Hillsborough Ave. about 5:15 p.m. that day about a man, later determined to be Malzone, bleeding from his neck behind the Wendy’s.
When the woman walked back through the parking lot about eight minutes later, another witness asked if she’d seen the attack.
About 10 seconds later, the video shows Caron emerging from the break in the fence and riding his bike east on Giddens.

title: Angola : Former South African Military Visit Southern Angola
message:
Ondjiva — Twenty-five ex-servicemen and war veterans from South Africa and their families organised a tourist excursion to the municipality of Cahama, southern Cunene Province, from 18th to 20th of this month, with the aim of visiting former combat zones and other historical sites.
The tour by the Association of Former South African Combatants of Battalion 61 focused on visiting the former command post of the 2nd Motorised Infantry Brigade of the former FAPLA (governmental forces).
The delegation camped for 24 hours in the bunker compound, where during the night they gave several testimonies and exchanged experiences about the times of conflict and fraternised with members of the administration.
He said that the delegation intended to take an eight-day trip to the south of Angola, to the province of Cuando Cubango, with their return planned for the 25th, via Cunene.
Cahama - the scene of resistance to the South African occupationThe municipality of Cahama was the scene of the resistance struggle against the South African invasion of 1981, where intense and bloody fighting took place for seven years, forcing the South African regional military power to withdraw.

title: Milrem Robotics Unveils Artificial Intelligence - Guided Tactical Unmanned Ground Vehicle
message:
In a world where technological innovation is the driving force behind military advancements, Estonian company Milrem Robotics has stepped into the spotlight by introducing a cutting-edge AI-guided tactical unmanned ground vehicle (UGV).
Milrem Robotics and Leonardo CollaborationThe collaboration between Milrem Robotics and Leonardo represents a significant milestone in the field of robotic combat systems.
Milrem Robotics and Loc Performance CollaborationIn addition to their collaboration with Leonardo, Milrem Robotics has previously ventured into the US Army’s quest for advanced robotic combat vehicles (RCV).
Announced in June 2023, Milrem Robotics partnered with Michigan robotics firm Loc Performance to develop a “groundbreaking” Robotic Combat Vehicle – Light (RCV-L) for the US Army’s competition.
By participating in this consortium, Milrem Robotics is actively contributing to developing methods that will shape the future of manned and unmanned military operations.

title: Waymo robotaxi rollout overcomes regulatory roadblocks in California
message:
The road is a little clearer for Waymo's self-driving taxi ambitions in California.
San Mateo County and LA pushed to delay Waymo's rollout until city governments could exert greater local control.
A proposed state bill that would've granted local governments authority over self-driving vehicles operating in their jurisdictions boosted county officials' hopes.
Concerns raised by local officials are not unfounded.
That said, Waymo has yet to reveal specifics on when it might start commercial driverless rides in San Mateo County.
